body:
> It seems to be a bug. And for the padding, you can use symbolOffset to get the same result.
> 
> ```js
> {
>   symbolOffset: [0, -20]
> }
> ```

Thanks a lot. That works

I found the solution in [here ](https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/issues/3098):
symbolOffset: [0, -20]

I think this would be a great improvement too, mainly for using in a mobile device with a larger dataset. But since the legends is rendered using canvas, I think implement it wouldn't be so easy as it appears. As a workaround it could be implemented a feature where the legend is rendered as a SVG rather a canvas. Then, in the chart option we'd set the legend type as 'plain', define a max width (static or inherited from parent) and then, with css, use overflow-x: scroll.
嗯嗯，一定一定。非常期待这个功能的上线

Good afternoon. Any news 'bout this issue?

It is a visualMap defect.
Currently visualMap only support "category" on axis, where the category data will be mapped to ordinal index (0, 1, 2, ...). 
If not on axis, the raw data value will be stored as string, which case visualMap does not supported yet.

Should be improved.

When I check the options here, https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-bar.markArea, it just saying: And I still don't known what does the markArea means. It's much better if there were a picture showing what the markArea looks like.
@Leipeifeng Please provide a demo for the issue either with https://jsfiddle.net/ovilia/n6xc4df3/ or https://gallery.echartsjs.com/editor.html.

@kuige Thanks for your advice. In fact, we have https://echarts.apache.org/zh/cheat-sheet.html this tool designed just for the consideration of introducing components. Perhaps we should add markArea there. Do you have questions on other components?
Does `show: false` work for you?

This is caused by:
1. When `symbolSize` is set to be too small, [canShowAllSymbolForCategory](https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/commit/aad1e1cf7d9829b2cfc5f35bbe3443b1b4dfd53a#diff-cce4eb3566bf44149635dafef0869e53R323) returns true but labels are too crowded in this case.
2. Due to sampling, some points are not visible so that their labels are not shown. But should we display nearby labels? This should also be discussed more in 5.0.

Label collision detection should be improved in 5.0. For now, we'd advice to set `showAllSymbol` to be false when sampling.

Just give me the solution with my given example. In x-axis I want 1 3 5 7 ........

But result of the hidden number will remain.

Just label of Co-ordinate will hide one after another.

Hi @a5hk . It's a good suggestion. Currently you can use inner methods.
```js
getModel().getComponent('calendar').coordinateSystem.dataToRect(date);
```

Hi @a5hk . You can use left/right/top/bottom/width/height properties to location the calendar.

For example:
```js
    calendar: {
        // It will leave 100px gap for each side
        left: 100,
        right: 100,
        top: 100,
        bottom: 100,

        orient: 'vertical',
        // cellSize is auto
        cellSize: ['auto', 'auto'],
        .... 
    },
```
地图的标签位置是不能设置的，固定显示在行政区域的位置。不太清楚需要设置 position: 'left' 的场景是什么

> Does `show: false` work for you?

I want to keep breadcrumb except first empty part('serie name'). Is it possible to` show: false` for only first portion.

Hi @6axter82  ,

Thanks,
Sergios.

Hello @yufeng04 ,

I just read my description and the _proposed API_ doesn't make any sense. I'll try to rewrite it here.

**What does the proposed API look like?**

Basically when we have _tooltip.trigger Axis_ and the _tooltip.formatter Callback function_ is called can you add a Boolean property to the _params_. That parameter will be called **_focused_** that will be True when the mouse is hovering over the specific series at that moment when the tooltip was triggered.

Thank you for you time and effort.

Best regards,
Sergios.

Hello @pissang @Ovilia ,

I added a button to the [jsfiddle example](https://jsfiddle.net/rw3vcy9t/1/) which sets the chart options, so you can see the error more easily. Also updated to the latest ECharts version 4.7.0. 

Basically every time you click the "Set Chart Option" button, and you drag the _zoom slider_, the labels on the _zoom slider_ are wrong.

Thank you for your time and effort on this.

Best regards,
Sergios.

Hi there @100pah @pissang  ,

this issue still occurs with the [latest echart examples](https://echarts.apache.org/examples/en/editor.html?c=mix-line-bar) and version 4.7.0.
Can you take a look at this.

Thank you for your time and effort.

Best regards,
Sergios.

Hi @100pah ,

regarding your comment on https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/pull/9977
do you have an update on this ?

Thank you for your time and effort.

Best regards,
Sergios.

Hi, I was looking for the same feature until I found this issue. What about starting with a simple approach which allows users to be able to set the `curveness` at least manually, until you find a nice algorithm to set the `curveness` automatically?

Also there is another issue that if you want to add a loop edge(an edge which has the source and the target nodes are the same) it does not show it at all.

The best way to solve this issue is as follows,
```
grid: { containLabel: true },
```
A configuration may  be needed  to control Y-axis stacking.

Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. 🎉
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! 🍵
